availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

ab.bibl: Mrs. Anna Harrison, obituary, Corning (New York, USA) Evening Leader, 4 May 1953, p. 3, col. 2.
ab.head: Obituary
Mrs. Anna Harrison
ab.p:
Mrs. Anna Harrison, 82, for‐
merly of Hornby, died Saturday
evening at the home of a son, John
Harrison, at Hamilton.

She was born at Hornby, July
23, 1870, the daughter of William
and Marguerite Dougherty Mc‐
Laughlin. At St. Mary’s rectory in
Corning, she was married to El‐
mer Harrison. The couple had re‐
sided for many years in Hornby un‐
til the time of Mr. Harrison’s death
10 years ago. At that time Mrs.
Harrison went to Hamilton to make
her home with her son John.

While at Hornby she was a
member of St. Vincent de Paul’s
Church, Corning, and the Hornby
Grange. In Hamilton she became
a communicant of St. Mary’s
Church.

She is survived by two other
sons: Leo of Painted Post and
Gerald of Rochester; a daughter,
Mrs. Fred Mosher of Earlville; a
sister, Mrs. Kathryn Hendricks of
Hornby; grandchildren: Gale Har‐
rison of Rochester, Barry Mosher
of Earlville, Miriam and Sally Har‐
rison both of Hamilton; several
nieces and nephews.

Friends are invited to call at
the A. W. Beilby and Son Funeral
Home this evening from 7 to 9
and Tuesday from 1 to 5 and 7
to 9 o’clock. The funeral will be
Wednesday morning with an 8:30
prayer from the funeral home fol‐
lowed at 9 o’clock by services in
St. Vincent de Paul’s Church. Bur‐
ial will be in Hornby.
ab.bibl: Mrs. Anna Harrison, obituary, Corning (New York, USA) Evening Leader, 5 May 1953, p. 6, col. 5.

ab.bibl: Mrs. Anna Harrison, funeral notice, Corning (New York, USA) Evening Leader, 6 May 1953, p. 2, col. 6.
ab.head: Funeral
Mrs. Anna Harrison
ab.p:
The funeral of Mrs. Anna Har‐
rison, formerly of Hornby, was
held this morning at 8:30 in the
A. W. Beilby and Son Funeral
Home and at 9 o’clock in St.
Vincent de Paul’s Church. The
Rev. Daniel Hogan, assistant pas‐
tor, said the Mass. In charge at
the grave was the Rev. Joseph
Guilfoil, pastor.

Bearers were Joseph, Dudley,
John, Arthur, and William Mc‐
Laughlin and Basil Hendricks, all
nephews.
ab.bibl: Mrs. Anna Harrison, funeral notice, Corning (New York, USA) Evening Leader, 7 May 1953, p. 6, col. 3.
ab.head: Funeral
Mrs. Anna Harrison
ab.p:
The funeral of Mrs. Anna Har‐
rison, formerly of Hornby, was
held Wednesday morning at 8:30
in the A. W. Beilby and Son Funer‐
al Home and at 9 o’clock in St.
Vincent de Paul’s Church. The
Rev. Daniel Hogan, assistant pas‐
tor, said the Mass. In charge at
the grave was the Rev. Joseph
Guilfoil, pastor.

Bearers were Joseph, Dudley,
John, Arthur, and William Mc‐
Laughlin and Basil Hendricks, all
nephews.
